title: Herd Behavior in Housing
description: A quick win: understand Herd Behavior in Housing.

hook.text: When your neighbor buys a house and brags about the profit, you feel an irresistible urge to do the same.

buildup.text: Psychologists call it herd behavior â€” the tendency to follow the crowd, especially in financial decisions.

discovery.text: During booms, social proof replaces financial analysis. 'Everyone is buying' becomes the only research needed.

twist.text: Herds don't just form in booms. In crashes, panic selling is also a herd â€” running the opposite direction.

climax.text: Markets overshoot in both directions because humans evolved to follow the group, not question it.

punchline.text: We buy because everyone buys. We sell because everyone sells.

quiz.question: What drives herd behavior in housing markets?
options: Social proof and the tendency to follow others
